title: US President Warns Russia of Severe Tariffs Over Ukraine War Deal
snippets:
President Trump has made some big shifts in U.S. policy on Russia's war with Ukraine lately.

In the course of two weeks, Trump halted and reinstated weapons to Ukraine and he began openly showing frustration with Russian president Vladimir Putin's continued military escalations.
In dramatic U-turn, US president boosts arms for Ukraine and threatens tariffs on Russia.
The US president said he was "very unhappy" with Russia and warned that there would be "very severe tariffs" if there was no deal to end the war in Ukraine in 50 days. DW has more.
titles: Trump threatens Russia over Ukraine. Will it make a difference?
Trump threatens Russia with ‘severe’ tariffs, announces Ukraine arms deal
Ukraine updates: Trump warns Russia of 'very severe tariffs'
summary: The US President expressed dissatisfaction with Russia and issued a warning of "very severe tariffs" if a deal to end the Ukraine war is not reached within 50 days. This statement was made during a meeting with NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte in the Oval Office. The president's remarks aim to increase pressure on Moscow to negotiate a peace agreement with Ukraine, addressing the conflict that started in 2022.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the current geopolitical situation between the US, Russia, and Ukraine. It provides context about the ongoing conflict and the US's strategy to address it. However, it doesn't highlight any specific solutions or progress towards resolving the conflict, nor does it provide in-depth insight into the systems or causes at play.

title: Meta built its AI reputation on openness — that may be changing
